name: COLD METAL theory
description:
COLD METAL theory
Christopher & James Rose
Belle Vue Press 2003
ISBN: 0-9522151-6-0
Hand finished and numbered limited edition of 50
A5, 20 pages, card cover, stapled

The first part of the COLD METAL theory trilogy.
Taking science fiction as its theme, the text was written using the cut-up technique pioneered by long-term drug addict William S. Burroughs. Science fiction is a genre ideally suited to this method of writing, allowing an exploration of both inner and outer space. This bookwork contains the first part of COLD METAL theory and a series of short pieces by each author.

name: On Scarecrow Wings
description:
On Scarecrow Wings
Christopher & James Rose
The House Of Inle 2005
ISBN: 0-9551308-0-8
Hand finished and numbered limited edition of 25
A5, 40 pages, spiral bound, board cover, black vinyl detail

The second part of the COLD METAL theory trilogy.
Continuing the science fiction theme and the use of the cut-up technique it has been described as "more intensely personal" than the first bookwork. It contains further short pieces from each author.

name: COLD METAL theory : A FRAGMENT
description:
COLD METAL theory : A FRAGMENT

In January 2004 the authors of COLD METAL theory were comissioned by "For Your Pleasure" to produce a video and slide interpretation of the bookwork for exhibition at their Alive! night at Cargo, London. 
A folded bookwork was produced for the event and given out on the door as patrons entered the club. It is an A3 sheet folded down to A6 and contains sections of the text from COLD METAL theory. 

It was produced as a numbered limited edition of 200.
